Vector package¶

Submodules¶

Vector.vector module¶

exception Vector.vector.SizeException(msg=None)[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Exception class raised when two sizes are different

class Vector.vector.VectorHelper(string_vector)[source]¶

Bases: object

Main class

the class offers methods to opperate on vectors

Attributes
elements: a list which contains elemeents of the vector size: an int containing the number of elements
MinMax()[source]¶

Returns both Min and Max of Vector

Returns:
a tuple containing min and max values of the vector
get_elements¶

Gets elements of Vector

Returns:
A list of the vector’s elements.
inverse()[source]¶

Returns reversed elements of the vec

Returns:

a list containing reversed elements of vector example:

{(1,2,3)} —> {(3,2,1)}

size¶

Gets size of the vector

Returns:
the size of the vector
somme(other)[source]¶

Returns sum of 2 vectors

Adds two vectors element by elemen. if size of vectors is not the same an exception is raised.

Args:
Other: the list of elements we want to add to our vector
Returns:

a new list contaion the sum of the two vectors example:

self = {(1,2,3)} and other = {(2,3,4)} returns {(3,5,7)}

Raises:
SizeException: if the two vectors have different sizes.
sort()[source]¶

Sorts Elements of the vector
